name: Special Topics in Language Change
description: This course examines current issues of theoretical and/or empirical relevance in linguistics with special reference to phenomena involving language change. Depending on the instructor, the focus of the course may be more oriented towards phonology, morpho-syntax, semantics, or the lexicon. [24L, 12T]
prerequisites: LIN231H5/LIN232H5/LIN247H5, and LIN256H5//LIN258H5, plus 0.5 credit in a 300-level LIN course.
